lines.content: Github Copilot's GPT-5 was used to create the `clear` command.
checkParser(CLEAR) returns true when the input is strictly clear.
- Getter getClearMatcher() added for parity with other commands.
- Added public clearAll() that delegates to the existing reset logic (clears ArrayList and resets storage file).
- “Your list is already empty.” when nothing to clear, else
- Message is short, actionable, and clear.
- If KingParser.Commands.CLEAR is matched, record previous size, call kingTaskList.clearAll(), return kingUI.showClear(prev).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Launcher.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Launcher.main()` (if the
editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see the GUI popup.
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)

> I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great
The King is there to assist you with your *small-task management 24/7* ⏱️. With the following features:
- Manage todo tasks, deadlines and events
Shows a message explaining the commands that can be used with the King.
Lists all the tasks in your task list. Adding `/sorted` returns your task list sorted by priority.
The King allows you to add three types of tasks: todos, deadlines and events.
- Todos are basic tasks with a priority.
- Deadlines are tasks that have to be completed by a date.
- Events are tasks that have a certain period.
- Event format: `event DESCRIPTION /priority PRIORITY /from YYYY-MM-DD /to YYYY-MM-DD`
It is decreed! I have added this task to thy realm:
[E][ ][Very High] SoC Career Fair (from: 23 Oct 2025 to: 10 Jan 2026)
Thou now hold 5 tasks in thy service.
The King allows you to search for tasks by deadline too.
Behold! These are the tasks that dwell within thy service:
The King allows you to search for tasks with multiple string matching.
Lo! These tasks dost match thy search:
5. [E][ ][High] SoC Career Fair (from: 23 Nov 2025 to: 31 Dec 2025)
Thou now hold 5 tasks in thy service.
The King lets you mark the completion of any type of task at the index specified.
Tasks decreed for 31 Dec 2025 are as follows:
The King lets you delete tasks you no longer need.
By my command, this task is struck from the royal record.
[E][ ][High] SoC Career Fair (from: 23 Nov 2025 to: 23 Dec 2025)
Thou now hold 4 tasks in thy service.
The King lets you clear all tasks from your task list.
By my will, all 4 tasks have been swept clean from thy list.
* King bot class that manages the parser, task list and UI
* Instantiates the King bot to handle user messages
// Initialise UI, Storage, Parser and TaskList
* @return Generated bot introduction on start of bot
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* Checks through all the commands and returns the appropriate string message
// help command - lists the possible commands you can give to the King bot
// list command - lists all the current tasks in your task list
// due command - lists all tasks on a certain due date
// find command - finds all tasks with a certain name
// todo command - creates a new todo task
// deadline command - creates a new deadline task
// event command - creates a new event task
// mark command - marks a task complete
// unmark command - marks a task incomplete
* Checks the help command and returns the help text
* Checks the list command for [/sorted] parameter and returns the list of tasks
* Checks the parameters of the due command and returns the list of tasks
* @return Message for list of tasks due on date
* Checks the parameters of the find command and return the list of tasks
* @return Message for list of tasks matching find substring
* Checks the parameters of the todo command and returns the created task
* @return Message for success / error in creating todo task
* @throws KingException Error in creation of todo task
* Checks the parameters of the deadline command and returns the created task
* @return Message for success / error in creating deadline task
* @throws KingException Error in creation of deadline task
* Checks the parameters of the event command and returns the created event
* @return Message for success / error in creating event task
* @throws KingException Error in creation of event task
* Checks the parameters of the mark command and returns the marked event
* @return Message for success in marking task complete
* Checks the parameters of the unmark command and returns the unmarked event
* @return Message for success in unmarking task complete
* Checks the parameters of the delete command and returns the deleted event
* @return Message for success in deleting task
* Clears the items in the list
* @return Message for success in clearing task list
* Enumeration of all possible IO errors for King
INVALID_COMMAND("Error! That command is not known within mine kingdom."),
MISSING_TASK_DESCRIPTION("Error! Thou hast forgotten the task’s description! "
+ "Provide it after thy decree of todo, deadline, or event."),
MISSING_TASK_PRIORITY("Error! Thou hast given no priority to this task! "
INCORRECT_TASK_PRIORITY("Error! Such a priority doth not exist in mine court! "
FIND_MISSING_SEARCH("Error! Thou hast offered no search word! "
DEADLINE_MISSING_DEADLINE("Error! No deadline hath been proclaimed! "
EVENT_MISSING_FROM_TO_DATE("Error! Both from and to dates are absent! "
EVENT_FROM_AFTER_TO("Error! Thy ‘from’ date lies beyond thy ‘to’ date. Such disorder shall not stand!"),
MARK_MISSING_INDEX("Error! No mark index hast thou given!"),
UNMARK_MISSING_INDEX("Error! No unmark index hast thou given!"),
DELETE_MISSING_INDEX("Error! No delete index hast thou given!"),
INVALID_DATABASE("Error! [KingStorage] The royal archive containeth invalid data."),
CORRUPTED_DATABASE("Error! [KingStorage] The royal archive may be corrupted! "
+ "Tasks henceforth created shall not be preserved in the record.");

* UI Manager for the King that helps with printing of statements
* Shows introduction message at start of conversation
return ("Greetings, subject! I am King, sovereign of thine tasks.\n"
+ "Speak thy command! Use `help` shouldst thou require guidance.");
* Shows help message for help command
return "You seek counsel? Behold, the royal decrees thou may utter:\n"
+ " list [/sorted] - Present before me all tasks in thine service [or ranked by descending priority]\n"
+ " due [YYYY-MM-DD] - Reveal unto me tasks due upon a chosen date\n"
+ " find [string1] [string2] ... - Summon tasks whose words match thy search\n"
+ " todo [task name] /priority [VL (Very Low) / L / M / H / VH (Very High)] - "
+ "Command me to create a humble todo\n"
+ " deadline [task name] /priority [VL (Very Low) / L / M / H / VH (Very High)] "
+ "/by [YYYY-MM-DD] - Declare a task with a fated deadline\n"
+ " event [task name] /priority [VL (Very Low) / L / M / H / VH (Very High)] "
+ "/from [YYYY-MM-DD] /to [YYYY-MM-DD] - Proclaim an event spanning a period\n"
+ " mark [index] - Mark a task as triumphant and complete\n"
+ " unmark [index] - Return a task to its unfinished state\n"
+ " delete [index] - Banish a task from thy sight\n"
+ " clear - Banish all tasks from thy sight\n"
+ " bye - Take thy leave of mine audience\n"
+ " help - Summon once more this scroll of commands";
